data.title: The Meadville Tribune
data.meta_description: Dennis Lyons passed away. This is the full obituary where you can share condolences and memories. Published in the The Meadville Tribune on 2023-10-27.
data.text:
Dennis Wayne Lyons, 77 of Carlton, died on Thursday, October 26, 2023 at the Meadville Medical Center. Born, August 9, 1946 in Mercer County, he was the son of Joseph and Antoinette Herron Lyons. He married Carol Crowser on January 10, 1970 and she survives.

Dennis worked for several years at Koski Construction in Ohio and also for Foster Grading. He was a member of Our Lady of Lourdes Catholic Church in Cochranton, enjoyed hunting pheasants with his Springer Spaniels and was a member of the Meadville and Cochranton Sportsmen's Clubs.

In addition to his wife, he is survived by a daughter Jill Lyons and her children Rachel and Jacob Lunny of Maryland and a son Greg Lyons of Florida and a sister Dorothy Echon of Lower Burrell.

He was preceded in death by his parents, a son Scott Lyons, two sisters Joann Segaty and Mary Reash and a brother, Joseph Lyons.

Friends and family will be received at the DICKSON FAMILY FUNERAL HOME, INC., 123 S.Franklin St., Cochranton on Wednesday, November 1, 2023 from 4:00pm until 7:00pm.

Mass of Christian Burial will be 11:00am, Thursday at Our Lady of Lourdes Catholic Church with the Rev. Jeff Lucas as Celebrant. Interment will be in the New Lebanon Cemetery.

Memories and condolences can be shared at www.dicksonfamilyfuneralhome.com.

Published on October 27, 2023

Note: These are general guidelines; some florists may not be able to operate within these timelines. During peak periods such as Valentineâ€™s Day, Memorial Day and most holidays, florists are not always able to keep up to demand. Tribute will contact you if there are any issues.

Plant a tree: How does it work

When your purchase is complete, a post will be made on the tribute wall of the deceased signifying the planting of a memorial tree.

An official certificate recognizing your purchase will be included with your email receipt. You can then forward the email to the family or print it and give it to them personally.

After an order is placed, our forestry partners will plant the tree in the area of greatest need (nearest the funeral home), according to the planting schedule for the year.

Due to seasonal conditions, the tree planting takes place during the spring and summer.

Tree Planting Timeline

Orders placed in:

January - May

Planting will take place in Spring or Summer of the same year.

June - December

Planting will take place in Spring of the following year.
